Year Date Event
330 AD 11 May Constantine I dedicates Constantinople (modern-day Istanbul) as the new capital of the Roman Empire.
395 AD 17 January Death of Emperor Theodosius I. The Roman Empire is divided between his two sons: Arcadius (East) and Honorius (West).
The Byzantine Empire (Eastern Roman Empire) is formally established as a separate political entity.
527 AD 1 August Justinian I becomes Emperor of the Byzantine Empire. He begins extensive military campaigns to reconquer lost territories.
532 AD January The Nika Riots erupt in Constantinople, resulting in massive destruction and thousands of deaths.
1204 AD Fourth Crusade sacks Constantinople. The Byzantine Empire is fragmented into successor states.
1453 AD 29 May Fall of Constantinople. Ottoman forces capture the city, ending the Byzantine Empire (Eastern Roman Empire).
The last Byzantine Emperor, Constantine XI Palaiologus, dies defending the city. The last remnant of the Roman Empire falls.
